thread.title: Arsene Wenger admits he twice failed to sign N’Golo Kante – the man he credits with turning Chelsea into title favourites
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger admits he twice failed to sign N’Golo Kante – the man he credits with turning Chelsea into title favourites

author: dwright
title: Arsene Wenger admits he twice failed to sign N’Golo Kante – the man he credits with turning Chelsea into title favourites

organizations.name: boca juniors conte speaks antonio conte

text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENE WENGER admits he has twice failed to sign N’Golo Kante – the man he says has turned Chelsea into title favourites. 
Arsenal boss Wenger says he made two attempts to sign the French international midfielder, but on both occasions he came up short. Reuters 2 Arsene Wenger says he has twice failed to sign N’Golo Kante – and hinted it was down to the club not paying his wages 
And though he refused to reveal too much detail about the failed bids, Wenger left everyone in no doubt the reason Kante is not playing for Arsenal is because the club wouldn’t pay his wages. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Asked if he had ever tried to sign the brilliant midfielder, Wenger said: “When he was in France, when he was at Leicester. Getty Images Arsene Wenger says N’Golo Kante has turned Chelsea into title favourites 
“We cannot explain everything, but it is quite obvious when you look at where he has gone. 
“I do not want to talk more about that. Transfers are transfers.” 
Arsenal travel to Stamford Bridge nine points adrift of Chelsea in the race for the Premier League title. And Wenger is in no doubt one of the biggest reasons why Antonio Conte’s side are in such a good position is because of the one man – Kante. Saturday Premier League match preview featuring Chelsea v Arsenal 
He added: "N’Golo Kante has made a huge impact in that team, it is not a coincidence they are in the position they are and Leicester were in that position last year. 
"Maybe that defeat to us was a wake-up call, they have changed things in the right way, they have benefited by not being in Europe. 
"That has given Conte time to prepare and to get to know better the players. 
"The integration of Kante has had a huge impact." Latest football news TV TIMES What TV channel is Chelsea vs Arsenal on, what time is kick-off and what is SunSport’s score prediction?
